verb.description: (of a liquid or gas) filter gradually through a porous surface or substance.
examples: the water percolating through the soil may leach out minerals

verb.description: (of coffee) be prepared in a percolator.
examples: he put some coffee on to percolate

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin percolat- strained through, from the verb percolare, from per- through + colare to strain (from colum strainer).
